intro: Centaurea pinnatifida, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color, with prominent central disk florets surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea pinnatifida is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
